FIE_lbnfIJerIyf43b_8cQ.text: We just love it!  We are working our way through the menu. Their feature Burger is excellent. we haven't found anything on the menu we don't like!  Friendly wait staff. Neighborhood atmosphere.

-JYfMc-Nic3iXrs0YlDznQ.text: Great zucchini burger fried pickles are great, the servers are good.  The basil vegetable sandwich is fresh

a66kFxwh-P8xHs9U7FFwRg.text: I really like this place: the food is excellent and very fresh, the restaurant is very clean and spacious, and the 3-4 people we interacted with during our dinner were friendly. Very laid back with a great bar and open feel. Excited to go back....

QWyLX12GcxSjqveHPDlacw.text: This place is somewhere between a three and a four star place but gets the "local bonus" for a place that is just around the corner (if you're in Mint Hill), has wonderfully friendly staff and prices that don't have an uptown Charlotte premium on them - meaning: this place is really cheap compared to city places!   The food was slightly above average quality for this kind of place and I like that it also accomodates people who prefer a somewhat more healthy choice for their meals. They have vegetarian things and a raw vegetable side (nothing fancy, but hey, at least it's there).   The restaurant/bar is nice looking, clean and fairly modern, and on most nights it's pretty busy, so people must like it! Good place for a simple, affordable weekday meal out.  TAKEOUT: I don't think I'd recommend getting take-out food from here (which they do). I was in the restaurant one time when an unhappy customer came back and returned a bag of food he had no ordered. One time I did get takeout, it was all cold ten minutes later when I got home, because the hot sandwiches are not wrapped in foil or any other way that would keep them warm, and a friend's philly cheese steak sandwich had *zero* cheese on it.

lEqBOQTfkIZx1NOleBRWFw.text: My first visit to The Hill was very enjoyable.  I had the French Dip and highly recommend it.  This is not anywhere close to "classy" or high-end....it is simply a good neighborhood joint with good food, pleasant service, a dozen TVs, and a friendly feel to it.

6bnM1Hz2ra9ixjS4Krg6fQ.text: The BEST fried pickles EVER! made fresh daily. Fabulous service.  Fresh ingredients. Husband really liked his burger. Families, couples, people of all ages were there. We'll be regulars for now on.

tHUH9hsHRoSPdufsRpQMkg.text: I've had lunch here a few times and have been pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  The staff is friendly and timely.  Good place to have a sandwich in Mint Hill.  Much better than the previous Mint Hill Deli that was in this location up until 2010.

fOuJA56NyzGS1PwHCIdHHw.text: Great Food Great Prices!  I highly recommend you check out The Hill; they have a tremendous atmosphere!  I've gone with my wife for an evening few drinks and watch the sports games and brought our son the following day for a family dinner.  Great Wings- I am sort of a self proclaimed wing expert and was impressed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States
Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Great Food at a Great Price!

KqPQfl4Jdph46pqT3v4F7Q.text: Ordered take out twice and dined in twice. Had great experiences twice and not so great the other times (slow service/messed up order). I really want to love this place though since we just bought in the area recently and there are not too many options in Mint Hill.  Will definitely be back and hopefully can update the rating with another star.

vF4ho6ChJVQZ1HmRkfrE9Q.text: At the hill again for lunch.  Hot crispy wings and homemade soup while the car gets inspected next door.  Great way to pass the time.

rPiF71J7amIvncAR-mAn9g.text: I've been a couple times so far and I can say it's a nice little bar/pub. Their food is pretty much "bar food" with your standard fried pickles, wings, pizza, burgers and such. I've had the wings as well as the fried pickles. The wings are well prepared (a little on the smallish side) and with every Thursday the wings are only 50 cents which is a pretty good value. Nothing really notable about the friend pickles. The drinks as well seem to be reasonably priced so you can go in, have a meal and a couple cocktails and still get out for under 20$.  The inside is fairly basic. Bar to the right, seating to the front and left and kitchen and bathrooms in the back. A couple big screen TV's and jukebox. Still though, it feels comfortable and welcoming.  The service I've had there is pretty much average. Same server both times and she got the orders right checked up on us as much as we needed but wasn't overly friendly or neglectful either way. The owner (or general manager?) did stop by and check to make sure everything was well which is good to see that they are paying attention to how everything is being run.

zNGyZcAIrjWOWdshKUgjQw.text: This place is really good. So far I've had the French Dip and the wings. I didn't like the Hill style wings, but the hot wings were delicious. The French Dip is thin sliced London Broil and it is easily one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. The prices are reasonable, it's out of the hustle and bustle, and the service is good. Can't go wrong with this place.

QB1XLWsZWodsXZba1DTFBA.text: We recently moved to Mint Hill from the South Park area and have been exploring what our new home has to offer. The Hill is not the kind of place you drive 20 miles for. But it is exactly what you want in a neighborgood bar and grill. Good food, good prices and friendly service. It is so nice to have a place close by where the staff makes you feel welcome and you can tell they enjoy working there. Just what we were looking for and we look forward to becoming regulars.

ee9cQmOKDGAHsa5KjbdAPQ.text: Been to the Hill a few times now, mostly for their wing nights and I can say its a quaint hometown little grill and bar. It is definitely a lot nicer then the original Mint Hill grill and deli. The hill offers full beer, wine and liquor with some good beer selections. The menu is as to be expected for a local grill and bar. Not upscale but good quality sandwiches and appetizers. It is definitely one of the best places Mint Hill has to offer

_Gic7-TY7FTumVIhNZmzxw.text: Not pretty. But love the Hilly cheesesteak. Reliable bar food and good wings.

esG5DdbIdaXioLtm27JXsQ.text: I've enjoyed the 50 cent wings here on Tuesday and on Thursday. I like to come here after a long day at work and enjoy them alongside a cold beer. The wings I usually have in "Hill Style" flavor which is a sweet and spicy deal. I'm eager to try other things on the menu. More to come....

4UfXW45QJ7-x7y_qI8A-zg.text: Great atmosphere, good food, and cold beer!  The Black and Bleu Chicken Pita is awesome!!!!

ydBYgmzuw8vMy4H0dhv2sg.text: The hill is great!!! Best food in town!! French dip is amazing!!! Very clean place. Definatly recommend this place. The owner CERTAINLY built one heck of a business!!!

CC-wjOhcgSBGIBu5bxpq3g.text: Fresh yummy food at decent prices. The staff is pretty friendly. It's  jazzed up bar eats with a comfortable atmosphere!

xSb0GVvjEMmWPZBX1KkZIQ.text: Laid back with enough attentiveness from the staff to make you feel very welcome. You HAVE to try the Turkey Cuban. Prices are great and the beer is cold. Can't ask for much more. I just found a new "regular" place to go.

lc8WBFyTs4bS_mpAQ_-F9w.text: Very good food and good selection.Love the BLT with an egg on it (just like my family has always made them) Onion Petals and HBs are very good. Friendly staff.I support all eateries in Mint Hill and recommend The Hill.

9f5WimDFAZpOkHALuUbRAg.text: I cannot get enough of the french dip, and the fried pickles are amazing. It's a great place when you're not sure what you want to eat, they have a wide enough selection that you can always find something delicious that you want to eat. love it@

ki3GgPrJ_bD8Vwkrl9v0tQ.text: We tried a few different things, typical bar food items, to get a feel for the foods served.  Fries with Bacon and Cheese, the Fries tasted great, were crisp but light on cheese and bacon. I would have added more and gotten it through the Fries more not just over the top. The Wings were mild as asked, so right on with the heat, good flavor but ours were a little overdone. Moist chicken is preferable to crunchy for us. Onion petals were good but not home made, so you can't go wrong there. However....they had the absolutely most amazing burgers! My favorite was the Hills Piggy Burger, with Swiss, Tomato, Mayo. I think to have it with onion would have over powered the meat and egg flavor. They did an awesome job, juicy, nice size portion and great flavor. They weren't crowded and the noise level was fine, staff friendly and attentive. We will definitely go back again, to try a few more sandwiches to see if consistent. You can get bar type foods anywhere, but a great burger/sandwich is hard to find and nice to know where to go when you want a quick bite to eat. I think we'll try them for Lunch next time!

_G7aZtq_JV_Qc901kKTPoA.text: Great bar food with good pricing.  The staff is great and very attentive without being overbearing.   If you want bar food, this is an excellent choice.

k_quYyzF4yhT4XRnjCCX0Q.text: Moved to Mint Hill a few months ago and always saw that this place seemed to be packed so I decided to try it.  It was quite good.  Kind of like a Hickory Tavern sort of place, which Mint Hill already has a Dunwellz, which is basically the same thing, but I liked this place better.  It wasn't as busy on the inside as the parking lot would have you believe, because the lot was full but there were still three or four free tables, but it was a sunday night, so I imagine Friday and Saturday it would be full to capacity.  I ordered the Chicken Salad sandwich and a beer and was satisfied with my meal.  The fried pickles were a good appetizer too.  I would come back here and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a bar with good food here in Mint Hill.

77DzVWo9ke3d__XF5eJEdg.text: GREAT FOOD!! The Owner is Top Notch!!! The wings are awesome !!!  Great Bar and food!!

y8DGJPRMcIxSKtQtvXjB3g.text: This is my favorite place to visit on the drive down towards Charlotte. The atmosphere is of a small town family bar. Great food (I suggest the fried pickle slices) and friendly service. Plenty of tv's to watch the game it keeps a stock of good cold beers. Great spot.

S_SXu9j78PgxNfxArxmWDg.text: Great food. Great staff. Great atmosphere. A regular spot for us. Hill Style wings are amazing. The burgers are yummy and the BBQ is fantastic.

kprFFsxaLBi5k3g55zgPVw.text: I went here with my wife for the first time yesterday, and it won't be the last. We live right around the corner from here, and I'm surprised we hadn't come here sooner.  The Hill is nothing fancy. It's a neighborhood pub through and through, and that's not a bad thing. Their menu consists primarily of appetizers and sandwiches, and they have a great selection. My wife had the cheesesteak sandwich, and it was great (I ate half.). I had the fried bologna sandwich, and I enjoyed that as well. I can appreciate any menu that even includes such a sandwich. There were a lot of others on the menu that I wanted to try, so that made decision making difficult.  The beer selection was decent, with the usual domestics and some local varieties from OMB. Bring in some Birdsong!  Finally, the service here was great. It took a few minutes to be seated, but that was because our hostess was also the bartender, our server, and was bussing tables. Despite having so many jobs to do, she did them well and was very friendly.   I'll be back!

V_7BK1Cm5soXOFnJEetO6g.text: Came in here for lunch one Sunday, my first thought was this was def. the local hangout! The place was packed with people and the bar full of people watching Sunday football. It was really loud in there but I didn't mind, people were just getting excited over the game.  We had the fried pickles for an appetizer which were good, a little greasy but good. I originally ordered the zucchini burger but they came back several minutes later and told me that they were out so I ordered the veggie sub. I wasn't all that pleased with the sub but it could have been worse. I ordered the homemade chips as the side which were delicious. I would love to go back and try the burger some other time. They have a few local beers on tap as well which is nice.  If you are in the area this is a good place to stop for food.

czuVkmTWLVckBatXGTpYhA.text: Having just moved to the area, we were looking for a local bar to enjoy. I do feel bad  giving The Hill 3 stars because the food wasn't bad and the bartender was super nice.   The food is mostly all fried which I suppose is expected. I got a hotdog on a pretzel bun and it was delicious! My main issue was the crowd - it seemed as though the wait staff was very involved in sitting around chatting with the locals about gossip.   Prices of beer is very reasonable so that's a major plus in my book!

CNkHGXPNbmtnYm3pKamHpw.text: Stopped by for a quick snack and a drink and also new to the area.  This is only my second time here and I have felt most welcome both times!  On this visit Brittany was the bat tender, training a new waitress on a fairly busy day.  She was the best and maintained such a positive attitude to all in the craze!  High accolades to Ms Brittany and the whole gang here, including the folks in the kitchen

06CVcJqbxkvCt4wQ0qSuow.text: Nice local bar and grill. I had the chicken salad sandwich. Very tasty on toasted whole wheat. Food and service was good will recommend and visit next time I am in town.

puxluaI2soEAdDYBZVblzQ.text: Great service and great food! Glad to have found this spot so close by! The chicken salad and pimento cheese are worth getting some to go home as well!

VCC0hANSdN0fpguEx57NNg.text: Great Value. Very good service. Food was awesome. Started with Hill Wings- very tender & big. Sandwiches also very good. Will be back.

6GAiMHVMbn6KYInxXi-adw.text: You need to have an online menu with photos. I was there before change of ownership and it ordered a hot ham and cheese...... got some lunch meat and cheese on toast. NO THANKS. You need to have an on line menu with photos, nobody wants to order what they can not see! A True menu should come with photos!

VeNmmFj0czm7rIgXvuUfNA.text: Literally sat and waited for the waitress to take our order for 20 minutes. We finally got up and told another waitress we were leaving. This was our first and LAST time going here. The waitress sucked!

NzGqoe0c58R4nHcuRk1TGQ.text: I love to support local businesses, as I am born and raised in Mint Hill. My family and I have been to the Hill many times.. I remember when this used to be McEwen dress shop.. We have encountered neglectful service on several occasions. The staff was nice, but it seemed that every time we needed something, they were hanging out and talking at the bar. Also, we have called in to go orders a few times... once they said it would be at at least an hour...they were "really busy". Then another time we called to order food around 9:20 on a Saturday night and they said they couldn't take our order because they were "just closing early" because no one was there. Their hours are until 10:00. Either the manager/owner doesn't care or she/he needs to hire new staff. We went elsewhere, where we got good food and were satisfied_ @ Dunwellz.

s6HIgzqUNAGZSxFlq460DQ.text: Finally tried this place after living here for five months. Definitely will be back. Everyone's food was really good. Crab cake sandwich was awesome.

86EqL8pN56_HlaCWEkbwnQ.text: Excellent selection of food and beer, we have never left disappointed or hungry. Hill Burger is always a home run, the French dip is excellent and can't go wrong with their sweet potato tots. I usually try something different every time and the staff never lets me down with their recommendations.

INT1y9NKoUIk6M59ohvNbQ.text: The first time we tried to go to the Hill a few months ago, it was a lackluster experience, and we didn't even get as far as eating. A sign was up saying to wait to be seated, and we did. In fact, we waited quite a while, and although the staff was milling about and one employee even came over to adjust the TV right beside us, no one offered to seat us or even greeted us. They were busy (they always are--there's not many options in Mint Hill), but it seemed rather egregious, so we left.  Last week we decided to give them another try. This time we went for lunch, and were greeted by a sign instructing us to seat ourselves. We did and were promptly served. The food was better than I was expecting (the fries were excellent and my turkey Cuban sandwich hit the spot), and our waitress was friendly and attentive.   The first experience was 1 star; the second was 4, so I'll give them 3 overall. The Hill is worth a try if you're in the area. Just be ready for some bumps if they're overly busy.

mf2x3NYUST10_IjtsH1L4w.text: Our favorite neighborhood Bar and Grill.  We eat there at least once a week and always go away happy.  It starts with the great staff.  You can count of being greeting like a friend and neighbor.  Throughout your meal they will take special care of your every need.  The food is wonderful.  Everybody loves their Hill Style Wings. Just the right blend of hot and sweet.  The Hill Burgers are a crowd favorite.  Big and juicy and fixed just the way you want them.  The Crab Cakes are delicious.  My wife is from Maryland's Eastern Shore and these are the only ones that she'll order out.  The French Dip is big and meaty.    Get there early and beat the crowd.  It's a small place and they fill up pretty quick.

tlN-uQK3diE1wQOsUp5a9Q.text: Great family pub, something for everyone on the menu.  Good beer selection, good prices and great staff.

eBhx6xL76213HoT_QO4aHA.text: OH MY GOODNESS! I can't believe I haven't stumbled upon this place sooner... my husband and I are always looking for new places to try. I was out driving one day and drove right past this place and thought it would be fun to try.   We ate here Sunday around noon. We were able to pick our own seats. Our server Jayden was super awesome. The place was about halfway filled with customers. It was a nice Sunday vibe.   We started off with an order of fried pickles. YUMMY! I ordered the zucchini burger with sweet potato tots and my husband ordered the Cuban with pasta salad. The food was DELICIOUS. I have never had a zucchini burger before so I was very interested in trying it. It was beyond my expectations. My husband enjoyed his food as well!   Our order came out pretty quickly. I think we just found our new Sunday spot. Can't wait to come again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States
Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Zucchini burger with sweet potato tots
Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Fried pickles

4EU8u7JhHclSOssTcfd5mQ.text: First time here tonight- ordered takeout. The service at the bar was a little slow  but the bar was also busy. We ordered burgers and they took about 10-15 minutes to come out so not bad. The burgers were excellent! Juicy, well cooked and the bun sealed the deal! Soft and crispy at the same time and very flavorful- like a sweet taste. The side salad was big! Cheese fries were tasty and had a ton of cheese- throughout the fries, not just a small layer on the top.  While I was waiting order of wings were going out to a table and they looked so good and smelled even better! I can't wait to try them next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Side salad
Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Burger

kfx7O2dZGVBawjIDy9fsuw.text: My niece and I came to have dinner after a couple hours at the trampoline park.   We were seated quickly and the server was very polite as we were being seated.  I ordered a cheeseburger and my niece got the kids burger with Mac and cheese.  Food came out quickly and was delicious.  My niece ate every bite and said how good the burger was.  Will definitely be back.

XwcWxAiDZuCY9FjkEaSLGA.text: Finally tried this spot in Mint Hill, we've been driving by it for the past 2 years since we moved here. It was a great lunch spot!  There are plenty of sandwich options, we tried the crab burger and tuna salad sandwich.  Both sandwiches were awesome as well as their house made chips with ranch.  Their side salad was fresh and the Mac & Cheese side was really good.  We will definitely be back!

h06pvXlfpoxGwWksQwh4gQ.text: Went on burger night for the first time and that was one tasty burger. Really liked the fact that they had two local ipa's on draft. Loved the sweet tater tots. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States

TEGEGqBDyIGhDKrclwpalQ.text: Hanging out with a buddy of mine who lives in Midland. We found ourselves hungry and too lazy to cook.    We ended stopping at The Hill and certainly don't regret it. We started with their wings (Hill Flavor) and they were FANTASTIC!! Great fried wings that had a grill char to them before a sweet and spicy sauce topped it all off.  I then ordered the pepperjack steak and sandwich which was the special of the day. I don't like mayonnaise so I aksed them to keep that off the sandwich which in turn made it over all pretty dry. The meat and bread were both good quality, but then sandwich as a whole wasn't my favorite.    If you're going to get a side... get the Fried Pickles.... TRUST ME!!! They were hot and fresh and delicious and you can tell that they were actually battered in the kitchen and not frozen.   The only downfall was our drinks.. my draft beer was quite flat and my friends red bull /vodka took at least 15 minutes to make it to the table and was pretty much just the can of redbull poured into a regular ice tea glass.

blbpL01JFw9feWwku_2_LQ.text: Can't believe I haven't reviewed The Hill yet, it's my local goto for amazing cheeseburgers and special fries!  My food is ALWAYS good, and my favorite server Brittany ALWAYS makes sure I have a great dining experience.   I also totally recommend the wings!  They have a nice bar as well, and the interior is decorated in such a way as to encourage you to be comfortable and enjoy yourself.     The owner really believes in customer service too, the one time I had an issue, he apologized, fixed the issue and comp'ed the entire meal for both my date and I, despite me telling him that it was not necessary.     So The Hill has earned my patronage through a combination of great food, great staff, and a dedication to customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Cheeseburger and fries
Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Inside

0QAo9uhBvL-beba6ARDJdA.text: It was fine. The burger was pretty good, the BLT was just ok. It's definitely a locals sport bar, so not really my type of place, but if you care more about the sports than the food you might like it.  The servers were friendly though!

VXLv-_Hkk6TE22rUK8N4iA.text: There were a number of little issues but mainly the food was the biggest problem. I had previously called and specifically asked if they served cocktail drinks to which I was told yes, so my biggest complaint is that I ordered a pina colada and was told that they don't make it because there's no blender.  I researched this place quite a bit and felt it would be a great choice for a night out. I was disappointed, the place from the start was empty eventhough it is a small space. Ordered the pastrami and I know it isn't supposed to be dripping grease, it was not a pleasant meal, the side house chips were unsalted and burned. I know we will not go back to this place.

6vZD7wOrRcts1J3Jyt3y4Q.text: With the hill you get exactly what you should expect. Chicken wings, beer, and some other decent bar food. The place is just a relaxed bar and grill with a blue collar vibe. Very family friendly as well. Beer selection is good and they rotate taps. They could improve on being slightly more knowledgeable about the beers they are providing. Wings on Tuesdays and Thursdays are discounted, while they may not have many flavors they make the ones they have absolutely perfect.

M3La7kj0_5B3yHyvs_Va0g.text: We had zucchini sticks and chicken cesar salad. Delicious. Excellent service. We will be back.

wi1mHL3Iwr5KNS4twLiC2g.text: Friendly service and a loaded bar and grill menu.  I tried the chicken salad sandwich.  It was tasty, but you need to like walnuts because there's a lot in there.  I got the sweet potato tots for a side and they were really good.  The wings at the table beside me, looked and smelled really good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Chicken Salad Sandwich with Sweet Potato Tots

ql_gSO46YqXacg2uEFZFew.text: I have tried to give this place a try 4 different times, mainly because it's local and I like to support local businesses but I won't be back. The menu is pretty plain, the orders have been wrong each time, the food was cold and the tea was old and the order was wrong tonight. There has been nothing on the menu that is extraordinary and I am confused as to how it has such a high rating in Yelp. I REALLY wanted to love this place but it has fallen flat each time.

g5xk8cE4R6OaKhNRcvGATg.text: Friendly and attentive staff.  Great lunch for the family. Nice cozy atmosphere and delicious grill menu.

Q6lHPkUe12I3U7m9xq_Kiw.text: Some of the best wings I have ever had! Great atmosphere, friendly servers, good prices.  We have been here twice in two days. We will return next time we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Get the wings!

67zOmGrmgVz-afIAfOW0FA.text: We are moving to the area so decided to try some local places to see what we might like. Today's choice is stellar. Not fancy but super comfortable and relaxing.   We were greeted and served right away by a very friendly waitress.   I got the special chicken blt with the best sweet potato tots I've had in a while. My husband got the pastrami with fries. We both enjoyed the meal, atmosphere and staff.   We'll definitely be back!

vg5FxWLx2bc2LS8cA0E9Dw.text: We just moved to the area and have been to The Hill twice in a week. The food is awesome. It's great to have a local place to go get great, fuss-free food and a drink.

TvbJjHUST21Cyte3KLDMVQ.text: Service was painfully slow on a Friday night. We were seated right on top of the air vent so it was blowing cold air on me. Then it took our waitress forever to bring refills. She was really sweet and apologized for the 45 min wait. The Italian sandwich was just okay. They literally put it on a smooshed hot dog bun. I didn't pay $8.95 for a hot dog bun sandwich.  Drink specials are worth it, just not the food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hill Bar and Grill - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Hot dog bun sandwich. Not okay.

YwTepYxxwf6MWlJADB6CeA.text: My wife and I love this place. This is our new Goto for wings. I have found no better in the area for hot Buffalo style wings. Service is always good. Parking is on the sparse side though. There is always a lingering bathroom cleaner smell though, which I find odd.

rp2jqe9HwuO_b2WV_bCtXw.text: Service has improved drastically from earlier visits. Last couple of times we stopped in were great experiences. Wings are good, chips are really good and the veggie burger is excellent. We've been visiting more frequently now that they have improved the customer service.
